snippet: Inequality is a major reason the economy is still so depressed and unemployment so high, and we have responded to crisis with a mix of inaction and confusion.
abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column asserts that income inequality is a major reason the economy is still so depressed and unemployment so high, and why government has responded to crisis with a mix of inaction and confusion; contends that the political system has been warped and paralyzed by a small, wealthy minority. (M)
lead_paragraph: Before the Great Recession, I would sometimes give public lectures in which I would talk about rising inequality, making the point that the concentration of income at the top had reached levels not seen since 1929. Often, someone in the audience would ask whether this meant that another depression was imminent. Well, whaddya know?
